title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that considers v(t)=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E09@ earns the first point.

A response of “Stephen changes direction when his velocity changes sign” earns the first point for considering the sign of v(t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG2bGaaiikaiaadshacaGGPaaaaa@3C49@ but must include the answer of t=56 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGynaiaaiAdaaaa@3C7A@ in order to earn the second point.

A response of t=56 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGynaiaaiAdaaaa@3C7A@ with no supporting work does not earn either point.

Any presented values of outside the interval 0<t<90 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E34@ will not affect scoring.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The minimum work needed to earn the first point is v ′ (60)=− 0.036. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44AF@

  • a(60)=− 0.0360162 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46CD@ is not sufficient to earn the first point. The connection v ′ (t)=a(t) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4093@ or v ′ (60)=a(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4195@ must be explicitly shown.

A response must declare a value for a(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbGaaiikaiaaiAdacaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@3CB5@ to be eligible for the second point.

In order to earn the third point the presented conclusion must be consistent with a negative velocity at time t=60 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGOnaiaaicdaaaa@3C75@ and the presented value of a(60). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D67@

A response does not need to find the value of v(60); MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D88@ an implied sign is sufficient.

  • The statement “Stephen is speeding up because a(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbGaaiikaiaaiAdacaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@3CB5@ and v(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG2bGaaiikaiaaiAdacaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@3CC9@ have the same sign” (or equivalent) earns the third point, provided a negative value is presented for a(60). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D67@

A response that reports an incorrect sign or value of v(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG2bGaaiikaiaaiAdacaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@3CC9@ does not earn the third point. Any presented value of v(60) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG2bGaaiikaiaaiAdacaaIWaGaaiykaaaa@3CC9@ must be correct for the number of digits presented, from one up to three decimal places in order to earn the third point.

Degree mode: A response that presents answers obtained by using a calculator in degree mode does not earn the first point it would have otherwise earned. The response is eligible for all subsequent points (unless no answer is possible in degree mode or the question is made simpler by using degree mode).

  • In degree mode, there are two possible values for v ′ (60). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D88@ A response that declares v ′ (60)=− 0.000141. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@46DA@ does not earn the first point but would earn the third point in the presence of v(60)=0.042089 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43AF@ or v(60)>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8C@ and the conclusion that Stephen is slowing down.

  • Similarly, a response that declares v ′ (60)=0.039304 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43B6@ does not earn the first point but would earn the third point in the presence of v(60)=0.042089 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43AF@ or v(60)>0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E8C@ and the conclusion that Stephen is speeding up.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned only for ∫ 20 80 v(t)dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4345@ (or the equivalent) with or without the differential.

The second point is earned only for an answer of 23.384 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D64@ (or 23.383 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D63@ ) regardless of whether the first point was earned.

Degree mode: In degree mode, ∫ 20 80 v(t)dt =2.407982. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AEF@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned only for ∫ 0 90 |  v(t)  | dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A5A@ or ∫ 0 56 v(t)dt − ∫ 56 90 v(t)d t MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DE2@ (or the equivalent), with or without the differential(s).

The second point is earned only for an answer of 62.164 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D63@ regardless of whether the first point was earned.

Degree mode: In degree mode, ∫ 0 90 |  v (t) |dt =3.127892. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5046@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
